alert.note: Alert for Black Mesa Area; Chinle Valley; Chuska Mountains and Defiance Plateau; Eastern Mogollon Rim; Little Colorado River Valley in Apache County; Little Colorado River Valley in Coconino County; Little Colorado River Valley in Navajo County; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas Hwy 264 Northward; Northeast Plateaus and Mesas South of Hwy 264; Western Mogollon Rim (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued April 18 at 12:35PM MST until April 19 at 8:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 8 PM MST/9 PM MDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 50 mph. * WHERE...Eastern Coconino, Navajo and Apache Counties including the Little Colorado River Valley and the Mogollon Rim. This includes Flagstaff, Williams, Tuba City, Munds Park and Snowflake. * WHEN...Until 8 PM MST/9 PM MDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds could blow around unsecured objects. Saturated soils from snowmelt combined with the wind will result in an increased threat for blown down trees. In addition, winds this strong can make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Patchy blowing dust will develop with reduced visibility under 5 miles at times, mainly over the lower elevation areas north of the Mogollon Rim.
info.instruction: Use extra caution when driving, especially if operating a high profile vehicle. Secure outdoor objects.
